ygData.subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Hunting at 25
ygData.msgSnippet: On Tue, 31 Oct 2000 11:26:34 -0800, Dan s path  ... I remember a long time ago when I first ventured into Mistmoore.  I thought it was
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 31 Oct 2000 11:26:34 -0800, "Dan's path" <danspath@...>
wrote:

>Here is a question then. I've been groving from 20 to 25 in the lake
>of ill omen, easy exp, I only die now when...well, I haven't died in
>quiet a while! The down side is...bored. Ran a shadow knight from 1-8
>just to take a break.
>Tonight my lv 25 enchanter will be at Castle Mistmoore for the
>Halloween bash (Our guild, the Nameless of Norath, on the nameless
>server, is hosting a server wide raid). I need somewhere interesting
>and good for growth to hunt. But with enough people to not spend a
>long time standing around looking for a group. Should I stay in Castle
>Mistmoore? Or go else where? Or what?
>
>Vroc, Enchanter on the Nameless
>_____________________
>"The more I learn, o, the less I know
>Friend or foe? No, there's only Us"

I remember a long time ago when I first ventured into Mistmoore. I
thought it was one of the better zones in the game, and certainly
inside the castle itself one of the prettiest.

But now it's just empty whenever I go to play, and with nothing
suitable nearby and not being able to gate around the world, I can't
really go anymore :-(

A good alternative I also enjoyed was inside Cazic Thule. A great
place to really get into proper mezzing and develop those skills
nicely!! Can have some bad trains when it's busy though, but pick
your spot carefully and you'll be safe.

--
Melaniel, Wood Elf Bard (48) "Flirting is a girl's best friend"
Kalara, Enchanter (37) "LOADING, PLEASE WAIT ...."
Tura, Dark Elf Necromancer (10) "Jobantik, you really smell!"
